figure_1: Illustration of different molecular pathways involved in Basal cell carcinoma. Adapted with permission from [50]
figure_2: Representation of therapeutic landscapes involved in Cutaneous cell carcinoma. Adapted with permission from [56]
figure_3: Illustrates different types of Skin cancers
figure_4: Diagrammatic representation of the detailed mechanism of tumor vascularization
figure_5: Procedure for Mohs Microscopic surgery used for the removal of the tumor from the skin. Adapted with permission from [141]
figure_6: An illustration of the effector mechanism in photodynamic therapy. 1) Activation of the photosensitizer by external light of a specific wavelength results in the singlet state, which is followed by the creation of reactive oxygen species (ROS), which is the main cause of the apoptosis of tumor cells. 2) Photodynamic therapy activates the immune system, releasing inflammatory mediators like IL-6, IL-1, and TNF-alpha, heat shock protein (HSP), and DAMPs (Damage Associated Molecular Patterns), which cause tumor cells to die
figure_7: Illustration of cell types, processes, immunotherapy, and their effect on the tumor after intratumoral administration. Adapted with permission from [207]
figure_8: Representation of different approaches for the management of skin cancer
figure_9: Physical methods employed for enhancing the penetration ability of the drug
